cards.markdown:
There‚Äôs a place between two stands of trees where the grass grows uphill
and the old revolutionary road breaks off into shadows
near a meeting-house abandoned by the persecuted
who disappeared into those shadows.

I‚Äôve walked there picking mushrooms at the edge of dread, but don‚Äôt be fooled
this isn‚Äôt a Russian poem, this is not somewhere else but here,
our country moving closer to its own truth and dread,
its own ways of making people disappear.

I won‚Äôt tell you where the place is, the dark mesh of the woods
meeting the unmarked strip of light‚Äî
ghost-ridden crossroads, leafmold paradise:
I know already who wants to buy it, sell it, make it disappear.

And I won‚Äôt tell you where it is, so why do I tell you
anything? Because you still listen, because in times like these
to have you listen at all, it‚Äôs necessary
to talk about trees.

Organized Nurses Just Won A Groundbreaking Contract

Last week, the nurses union at the University of Michigan won a groundbreaking contract to address the harmful conditions created by austerity and corporate restructuring at Michigan Medicine during the COVID-19 pandemic.
At the onset of the pandemic, Michigan Medicine medical center

738 staff members following losses in revenue. After recuperating its losses and profiting by roughly $340 million by June 2021, Michigan Medicine did not rehire the workers, instead opting to expand staff responsibilities, mandate overtime hours, and create a management system in which workers reported experiencing moral trauma from the way burnout was reducing the quality of care for patients.

‚ÄúThey made millions on the backs of nurses working harder and harder, and nurses got to the point where we couldn‚Äôt do it anymore,‚Äù Renee Curtis, president of the Michigan Nurses Association-University of Michigan Professional Nurse Council,

corporate governance by providing enforceable staffing ratios, rolling back mandatory overtime, and holding management accountable to adequately staffing the hospital.
